children.value: about the origin, it is an
function. This means that that the energy eigenstates will be alternatively
functions. In this question we will only be interested in the energy eigenvalues of the
solutions, i.e. every other energy, starting with the ground state.
Write down the time-independent Schrödinger equation in region I, and solve it, to show that the permissible solution in this region is

In this question we will derive the dimensionless form of the time-independent Schrödinger equation for the quantum harmonic oscillator.
The three dimensionful quantities for the quantum harmonic are the mass of the particle

children.value: In this question we will normalise the ground state and the first excited state of the quantum harmonic oscillator.
